author: Peter Nicholas
title: GOP Lawmaker Disputes Trump Claim of Campaign ‘Spies’
text:
WASHINGTON—A senior Republican congressman disputed President Donald Trump’s claim that “spies” infiltrated his 2016 campaign, saying that the Federal Bureau of Investigation was conducting a legitimate probe of Russian election meddling.
Rep. Trey Gowdy (R., S.C.), who heads the House oversight committee, also said he understood Mr. Trump’s frustration with Attorney General Jeff Sessions, who recused himself from the Russia investigation based on his involvement in the Trump campaign. Had Mr. Trump known earlier that Mr.... RELATED VIDEO Was ‘Spygate’ Spying or Standard FBI Procedure? In 2016, the FBI sent an informant to meet with two individuals on President Donald Trump’s campaign. The Wall Street Journal's Gerald F. Seib asks, was this meeting standard FBI procedure? Or was it spying, as Trump suggests? Photo: Getty
